text:
This is kind of hard to explain, but I will try my best.  When I make changes to
the index.html, it won't reflect those changes for several days.  Sometimes it
will though right away. Or sometimes not at all.  I've tried restarting apache2.
 I've tried restarting windows.  When I say it wont reflect the changes, I mean,
I can make slight or major changes, or even delete index.html completly, and it
still uses the one I had before doing anything.  The only things that seems to
remedy it it completely uninstalling apache2 and re-installing it after making
my changes.
creator: twmr2000@yahoo.com

text:
This is almost certainly a configuration issue, not a bug, and therefore belongs
on a user support forum like the users@httpd.apache.org mailing list.

(Hint: The file is being cached someplace.  This could be on your browser, on a
proxy (possibly transparent) between your browser and the server, or on the
server.  The only thing in httpd-2.0 that will do caching is mod_cache, so make
sure you have that module turned off.)
creator: slive@apache.org
